info.title: Rightbound External API
info.description:
Rightbound API for contacts enrichment 
# Need help?
email us at dev@rightbound.io

# Authentication using X-API-Key
To authenticate requests to the API, you need to include your API key in the header of each request. 
This API key is passed as the value of the `X-API-Key` header.

## Obtaining an API Key
To obtain an API key, please contact the administrator of the API. They will provide you with a unique key that grants access to the API's resources.

## Including the API Key in Requests
Once you have obtained your API key, include it in the header of each request you make to the API. Set the `X-API-Key` header to the value of your API key.
Here's an example of how to include the API key in a request using cURL:

```bash
curl -X GET   -H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY"   https://externalapi.rightbound.io/v1/credits
```

Replace YOUR_API_KEY with your actual API key.

### Security Considerations
1. *Keep your API key confidential*: Treat your API key as a sensitive piece of information and avoid exposing it in public repositories or sharing it with unauthorized parties.
2. *Use HTTPS*: Ensure that requests to the API are made over HTTPS to encrypt the communication between your application and the API server, preventing interception of the API key.

By including your API key in the X-API-Key header of your requests, you can securely authenticate and access the resources provided by the API.

post.description:
### Description 
The `v1/prospects/enrich` endpoint is used to request enrichment for a list of prospects based on specified settings.
Enrichment can include adding additional information such as mobile phone numbers and email addresses to the provided prospect data.
Once enrichment is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the enriched data.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the enrichment process is completed. The enriched data will be included in the payload of the callback request.
The enriched data will include the unique id for each prospect, allowing you to match the enriched data with the corresponding prospect in your system.

get.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/prospects/enrich/{job_id}/status` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of an enrichment job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the enrichment process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description
The `/v1/prospects/enrich/{job_id}/results` endpoint is used to retrieve the result of an enrichment job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description 
The `v1/prospects/match` endpoint is used to request a match for a list of prospects based on input parameters.
Once the match is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the match data.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the match process is completed. The match data will be included in the payload of the callback request.
The match data will include the unique id for each prospect, allowing you to match the matched data with the corresponding prospect in your system.

get.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/prospects/match/{job_id}/status` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of a match job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the match process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description
The `/v1/prospects/match/{job_id}/results` endpoint is used to retrieve the result of a match job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description
The `v1/prospects/track` POST endpoint, is used to request a track for a list of prospects and notify upon job changes.
If a callback URL was configured, once a change is being notified, a callback URL is invoked with the updated data.

get.description:
### Description
The `v1/prospects/track` GET endpoint, is used to request a list of tracked prospects.

parameters.name: sandbox

schema.description: Use for testing. When set to True, the API will generate a mock tracked prospect with the first track id attached in the request.

post.description:
### Description
## Beta 
The `v1/prospects/data_source/{data_source_type}` endpoint, returns the 10 latest data source per prospect.

get.description:
### Description
The `/v1/credits` endpoint is used to retrieve the number of available credits.
Credits typically represent units of currency or resources that can be consumed for various actions within the system.

### Description
The `/v1/credits/report` endpoint is used to retrieve a report of the amount of credits used for each submitted enrichment job.

parameters.name: from_date

schema.description: The minimum date from which to retrieve the credits report. This field should be provided as an epoch timestamp in seconds
schema.title: From Date

parameters.description: The minimum date from which to retrieve the credits report. This field should be provided as an epoch timestamp in seconds

parameters.name: to_date

schema.description: The maximum date from which to retrieve the credits report. This field should be provided as an epoch timestamp in seconds
schema.title: To Date

parameters.description: The maximum date from which to retrieve the credits report. This field should be provided as an epoch timestamp in seconds

schema.title: Response Get Credits Report V1 Credits Report Get

post.description:
### Description 
The `v1/search/prospects` endpoint is used to request search prospects from a list of companies based on search definition.
Prospect search definition is defined as a list of job functions.
The prospects found can be enriched with email and/or mobile phone.  
Once the process is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the data.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed.
The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

get.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/search/{job_id}/status` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of a search job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the search process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description 
The `/v1/search/{job_id}/results` endpoint is used to retrieve the result of a search job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/search/similar_prospects` endpoint search additional prospects who share the same company and persona characteristics as the input prospect.

get.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/search/similar_prospects/{job_id}/status` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of a search similar contacts job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the search process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description 
The `/v1/search/similar_prospects/{job_id}/results` endpoint is used to retrieve the result of a search similar contacts job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description 
The `v1/search/companies` endpoint is used to search companies by filters.
You must include at least one filter to search for companies.
Once the search is completed, a callback URL is invoked returning the results.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed.
The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

get.description:
### Description 
The `v1/search/companies/{job_id}/status` endpoint allows you to retrieve the status of an search job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
It allows you to monitor the progress of the search process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description 
The `v1/search/companies/{job_id}/results` endpoint allows you to retrieve the result of a search job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description
The `v1/companies/match` endpoint is used to search (and match) companies and return their company linkedin profile.
Each company object can include its name and/or domain.
Once the match is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the matched data.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed.
The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

### Description
The `v1/companies/match_all` endpoint is used to search (and match) companies and return all company linkedin profiles that were found.
Each company object can include its name and/or domain.
Once the match is completed, a callback URL is invoked with the matched data.

#### Callback
The callback will be made to the specified callback_url once the process is completed.
The data will be included in the payload of the callback request.

get.description:
### Description
The `v1/companies/match/{job_id}/status` endpoint allows you to retrieve the status of a match job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
It allows you to monitor the progress of the match process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description
The `v1/companies/match_all/{job_id}/status` endpoint allows you to retrieve the status of a `match all` job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
It allows you to monitor the progress of the match process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description
The `v1/companies/match/{job_id}/results` endpoint allows you to retrieve the result of a match job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

### Description
The `v1/companies/match_all/{job_id}/results` endpoint allows you to retrieve the result of a match all job by its unique identifier (`job_id`).

post.description:
### Description
## Beta
The `v1/companies/{data_source_type}` endpoint, returns the 10 latest data source per company.

get.description:
### Description 
The `v1/verify` endpoint is used to verify the validity of the api key.

post.description:
### Description
The `v1/track/contacts` POST endpoint is used to request or update a track for a list of contacts upon job or role changes.

### Request Payload
The request must include an array of contact objects, each containing:

- **`id`** (required): Your internal unique identifier for the contact.
- **Contact Information** (at least one of the following):
    - `first_name` and `last_name`
    - `linkedin_url`
    - `email`
- **Company Information** (at least one of the following):
    - `company_name`
    - `domain`
    - `company_linkedin_url`
    - 'email (work email)'

The `v1/track/contacts/tracked` GET endpoint, is used to request a list of tracked contacts.

schema.description: id of the account to get tracked contacts

parameters.name: settings_id

schema.description: id of the settings to filter by. takes precedence over account_id

parameters.description: id of the settings to filter by. takes precedence over account_id

delete.description:
### Description
The `v1/track/contacts/tracked` DELETE endpoint, is used to delete a contact track settings, effectively stop tracking a list of contacts.

parameters.name: contact_ids

schema.description: list of contact ids to delete. Should be at most 1000 contacts
schema.title: Contact Ids

parameters.description: list of contact ids to delete. Should be at most 1000 contacts

schema.description: id of the account to get tracked contacts
schema.title: Account Id

parameters.description: id of the account to get tracked contacts

parameters.name: settings_id

schema.description: id of the settings to filter by. takes precedence over account_id

post.description:
### Description 
The v1/meetings/summary endpoint generates a comprehensive pre-meeting summary based on the provided participant details.
 This summary is tailored to equip users with relevant insights and information about the participant before the meeting.

get.description:
### Description 
The `/v1/meetings/summary/{request_id}/status` endpoint is used to retrieve the status of a meetings summary request by its unique identifier (`job_id`).
This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of the meetings summary process and determine whether it is still in progress, completed successfully, or encountered an error.

### Description 
The `v1/settings` endpoint is used to get the customer settings.

post.description:
### Description 
The `v1/settings/public_key` endpoint is used to generate a public key.
 This key allows customers to verify the authenticity of webhook responses by checking their signature.
